subject: Re: [junit] How can I test an Exception
msgSnippet: ... assertTrue(message, false); is equivalent to fail(message); Also, I would put fail() right after exceptionThrowingStuff(). Also, I would only catch
messageBody:
Alexander Rupsch wrote:
> > Hi,all :
> > I am a frech man of Junit, and I have a question.
> > How can I test a case which I want it throws an exception.
> >
> > How can I test the Exception is the one I expected.
>
> public testException()
> {
> try
> {
> exceptionThrowingStuff();
> } catch(Exception e)
> {
> assertTrue(e instanceof YourException);
> assertEquals("Your Message", e.getMessage());
> }
> assertTrue("No exeption has been thrown!", false);
> }

assertTrue(message, false);

is equivalent to

fail(message);

Also, I would put fail() right after exceptionThrowingStuff().

Also, I would only catch YourException, and not Exception.

try {
exceptionThrowingStuff();
fail("Why didn't we throw an exception?");
}
catch (YourException expected) {
assertEquals("Your message", expected.getMessage());
}
